segment.source: Activate using Key Management Service (Windows 10)
segment.target: Activate using Key Management Service (Windows 10)

segment.source: Activate using Key Management Service
segment.target: Activate using Key Management Service

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: Looking for retail activation?
segment.target: Looking for retail activation?

segment.source: Get Help Activating Microsoft Windows
segment.target: Get Help Activating Microsoft Windows

segment.source: There are three possible scenarios for volume activation of Windows 10 or Windows Server 2012 R2 by using a Key Management Service (KMS) host:
segment.target: There are three possible scenarios for volume activation of Windows 10 or Windows Server 2012 R2 by using a Key Management Service (KMS) host:

segment.source: Host KMS on a computer running Windows 10
segment.target: Host KMS on a computer running Windows 10

segment.source: Host KMS on a computer running Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Host KMS on a computer running Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Host KMS on a computer running an earlier version of Windows
segment.target: Host KMS on a computer running an earlier version of Windows

segment.source: Check out Windows 10 Volume Activation Tips.
segment.target: Check out Windows 10 Volume Activation Tips.

segment.source: Key Management Service in Windows 10
segment.target: Key Management Service in Windows 10

segment.source: Installing a KMS host key on a computer running Windows 10 allows you to activate other computers running Windows 10 against this KMS host and earlier versions of the client operating system, such as Windows 8.1 or Windows 7.
segment.target: Installing a KMS host key on a computer running Windows 10 allows you to activate other computers running Windows 10 against this KMS host and earlier versions of the client operating system, such as Windows 8.1 or Windows 7.

segment.source: Clients locate the KMS server by using resource records in DNS, so some configuration of DNS may be required.
segment.target: Clients locate the KMS server by using resource records in DNS, so some configuration of DNS may be required.

segment.source: This scenario can be beneficial if your organization uses volume activation for clients and MAK-based activation for a smaller number of servers.
segment.target: This scenario can be beneficial if your organization uses volume activation for clients and MAK-based activation for a smaller number of servers.

segment.source: To enable KMS functionality, a KMS key is installed on a KMS host; then, the host is activated over the Internet or by phone using Microsoft’s activation services.
segment.target: To enable KMS functionality, a KMS key is installed on a KMS host; then, the host is activated over the Internet or by phone using Microsoft’s activation services.

segment.source: Configure KMS in Windows 10
segment.target: Configure KMS in Windows 10

segment.source: Open an elevated command prompt.
segment.target: Open an elevated command prompt.

segment.source: Enter one of the following commands.
segment.target: Enter one of the following commands.

segment.source: To install a KMS key, type slmgr.vbs /ipk KmsKey.
segment.target: To install a KMS key, type slmgr.vbs /ipk KmsKey.

segment.source: To activate online, type slmgr.vbs /ato.
segment.target: To activate online, type slmgr.vbs /ato.

segment.source: To activate by using the telephone, type slui.exe 4.
segment.target: To activate by using the telephone, type slui.exe 4.

segment.source: After activating the KMS key, restart the Software Protection Service.
segment.target: After activating the KMS key, restart the Software Protection Service.

segment.source: For more information, see the information for Windows 7 in Deploy KMS Activation.
segment.target: For more information, see the information for Windows 7 in Deploy KMS Activation.

segment.source: Key Management Service in Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Key Management Service in Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Installing a KMS host key on a computer running Windows Server allows you to activate computers running Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Sever 2008 R2, Windows Server 2008, Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows 7, and Windows Vista.
segment.target: Installing a KMS host key on a computer running Windows Server allows you to activate computers running Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Sever 2008 R2, Windows Server 2008, Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows 7, and Windows Vista.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You cannot install a client KMS key into the KMS in Windows Server.
segment.target: You cannot install a client KMS key into the KMS in Windows Server.

segment.source: This scenario is commonly used in larger organizations that do not find the overhead of using a server a burden.
segment.target: This scenario is commonly used in larger organizations that do not find the overhead of using a server a burden.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you receive error 0xC004F015 when trying to activate Windows 10 Enterprise, see KB 3086418.
segment.target: If you receive error 0xC004F015 when trying to activate Windows 10 Enterprise, see KB 3086418.

segment.source: Configure KMS in Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Configure KMS in Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Sign in to a computer running Windows Server 2012 R2 with an account that has local administrative credentials.
segment.target: Sign in to a computer running Windows Server 2012 R2 with an account that has local administrative credentials.

segment.source: Launch Server Manager.
segment.target: Launch Server Manager.

segment.source: Add the Volume Activation Services role, as shown in Figure 4.
segment.target: Add the Volume Activation Services role, as shown in Figure 4.

segment.source: Adding the Volume Activation Services role in Server Manager
segment.target: Adding the Volume Activation Services role in Server Manager

segment.source: Figure 4.
segment.target: Figure 4.

segment.source: Adding the Volume Activation Services role in Server Manager\
segment.target: Adding the Volume Activation Services role in Server Manager\

segment.source: When the role installation is complete, click the link to launch the Volume Activation Tools (Figure 5).
segment.target: When the role installation is complete, click the link to launch the Volume Activation Tools (Figure 5).

segment.source: Launching the Volume Activation Tools
segment.target: Launching the Volume Activation Tools

segment.source: Figure 5.
segment.target: Figure 5.

segment.source: Launching the Volume Activation Tools
segment.target: Launching the Volume Activation Tools

segment.source: Select the Key Management Service (KMS) option, and specify the computer that will act as the KMS host (Figure 6).
segment.target: Select the Key Management Service (KMS) option, and specify the computer that will act as the KMS host (Figure 6).

segment.source: This can be the same computer on which you installed the role or another computer.
segment.target: This can be the same computer on which you installed the role or another computer.

segment.source: For example, it can be a client computer running Windows 10.
segment.target: For example, it can be a client computer running Windows 10.

segment.source: Configuring the computer as a KMS host
segment.target: Configuring the computer as a KMS host

segment.source: Figure 6.
segment.target: Figure 6.

segment.source: Configuring the computer as a KMS host
segment.target: Configuring the computer as a KMS host

segment.source: Install your KMS host key by typing it in the text box, and then click Commit (Figure 7).
segment.target: Install your KMS host key by typing it in the text box, and then click Commit (Figure 7).

segment.source: Installing your KMS host key
segment.target: Installing your KMS host key

segment.source: Figure 7.
segment.target: Figure 7.

segment.source: Installing your KMS host key
segment.target: Installing your KMS host key

segment.source: If asked to confirm replacement of an existing key, click Yes.
segment.target: If asked to confirm replacement of an existing key, click Yes.

segment.source: After the product key is installed, you must activate it.
segment.target: After the product key is installed, you must activate it.

segment.source: Click Next (Figure 8).
segment.target: Click Next (Figure 8).

segment.source: Activating the software
segment.target: Activating the software

segment.source: Figure 8.
segment.target: Figure 8.

segment.source: Activating the software
segment.target: Activating the software

segment.source: The KMS key can be activated online or by phone.
segment.target: The KMS key can be activated online or by phone.

segment.source: See Figure 9.
segment.target: See Figure 9.

segment.source: Choosing to activate online
segment.target: Choosing to activate online

segment.source: Figure 9.
segment.target: Figure 9.

segment.source: Choosing to activate online
segment.target: Choosing to activate online

segment.source: Now that the KMS host is configured, it will begin to listen for activation requests.
segment.target: Now that the KMS host is configured, it will begin to listen for activation requests.

segment.source: However, it will not activate clients successfully until the activation threshold is met.
segment.target: However, it will not activate clients successfully until the activation threshold is met.

segment.source: Verifying the configuration of Key Management Service
segment.target: Verifying the configuration of Key Management Service

segment.source: You can verify KMS volume activation from the KMS host server or from the client computer.
segment.target: You can verify KMS volume activation from the KMS host server or from the client computer.

segment.source: KMS volume activation requires a minimum threshold of 25 computers before activation requests will be processed.
segment.target: KMS volume activation requires a minimum threshold of 25 computers before activation requests will be processed.

segment.source: The verification process described here will increment the activation count each time a client computer contacts the KMS host, but unless the activation threshold is reached, the verification will take the form of an error message rather than a confirmation message.
segment.target: The verification process described here will increment the activation count each time a client computer contacts the KMS host, but unless the activation threshold is reached, the verification will take the form of an error message rather than a confirmation message.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you configured Active Directory-based activation before configuring KMS activation, you must use a client computer that will not first try to activate itself by using Active Directory-based activation.
segment.target: If you configured Active Directory-based activation before configuring KMS activation, you must use a client computer that will not first try to activate itself by using Active Directory-based activation.

segment.source: You could use a workgroup computer that is not joined to a domain or a computer running Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2.
segment.target: You could use a workgroup computer that is not joined to a domain or a computer running Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2.

segment.source: To verify that KMS volume activation works, complete the following steps:
segment.target: To verify that KMS volume activation works, complete the following steps:

segment.source: On the KMS host, open the event log and confirm that DNS publishing is successful.
segment.target: On the KMS host, open the event log and confirm that DNS publishing is successful.

segment.source: On a client computer, open a Command Prompt window, type Slmgr.vbs /ato, and then press ENTER.
segment.target: On a client computer, open a Command Prompt window, type Slmgr.vbs /ato, and then press ENTER.

segment.source: The /ato command causes the operating system to attempt activation by using whichever key has been installed in the operating system.
segment.target: The /ato command causes the operating system to attempt activation by using whichever key has been installed in the operating system.

segment.source: The response should show the license state and detailed Windows version information.
segment.target: The response should show the license state and detailed Windows version information.

segment.source: On a client computer or the KMS host, open an elevated Command Prompt window, type Slmgr /dlv, and then press ENTER.
segment.target: On a client computer or the KMS host, open an elevated Command Prompt window, type Slmgr /dlv, and then press ENTER.

segment.source: The /dlv command displays the detailed licensing information.
segment.target: The /dlv command displays the detailed licensing information.

segment.source: The response should return an error that states that the KMS activation count is too low.
segment.target: The response should return an error that states that the KMS activation count is too low.

segment.source: This confirms that KMS is functioning correctly, even though the client has not been activated.
segment.target: This confirms that KMS is functioning correctly, even though the client has not been activated.

segment.source: For more information about the use and syntax of slmgr.vbs, see Slmgr.vbs Options.
segment.target: For more information about the use and syntax of slmgr.vbs, see Slmgr.vbs Options.

segment.source: Key Management Service in earlier versions of Windows
segment.target: Key Management Service in earlier versions of Windows

segment.source: If you have already established a KMS infrastructure in your organization for an earlier version of Windows, you may want to continue using that infrastructure to activate computers running Windows 10 or Windows Server 2012 R2.
segment.target: If you have already established a KMS infrastructure in your organization for an earlier version of Windows, you may want to continue using that infrastructure to activate computers running Windows 10 or Windows Server 2012 R2.

segment.source: Your existing KMS host must be running Windows 7 or later.
segment.target: Your existing KMS host must be running Windows 7 or later.

segment.source: To upgrade your KMS host, complete the following steps:
segment.target: To upgrade your KMS host, complete the following steps:

segment.source: Download and install the correct update for your current KMS host operating system.
segment.target: Download and install the correct update for your current KMS host operating system.

segment.source: Restart the computer as directed.
segment.target: Restart the computer as directed.

segment.source: Request a new KMS host key from the Volume Licensing Service Center.
segment.target: Request a new KMS host key from the Volume Licensing Service Center.

segment.source: Install the new KMS host key on your KMS host.
segment.target: Install the new KMS host key on your KMS host.

segment.source: Activate the new KMS host key by running the slmrg.vbs script.
segment.target: Activate the new KMS host key by running the slmrg.vbs script.

segment.source: For detailed instructions, see Update that enables Windows 8.1 and Windows 8 KMS hosts to activate a later version of Windows and Update that enables Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2 KMS hosts to activate Windows 10.
segment.target: For detailed instructions, see Update that enables Windows 8.1 and Windows 8 KMS hosts to activate a later version of Windows and Update that enables Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2 KMS hosts to activate Windows 10.

segment.source: See also
segment.target: See also

segment.target: Volume Activation for Windows 10
